source_sentence: 佛說大迦葉本經
translation: Mahākāśyapa-sūtra

source_sentence: 西晉三藏竺法護譯
translation: Translated by the Western Jin Tripiṭaka Zhu Fahou

source_sentence: 聞如是：一時，佛遊王舍城靈鷲山。
translation: Thus I have heard: One time, the Buddha was staying at Vulture Peak in Rājagṛha.

source_sentence: 爾時，城中有勢富梵志，名曰尼拘類(晉曰無恚)，財富無數，金銀七寶，
translation: At that time, there was a wealthy brahman named Nirgrantha (known as Wuqian in the Jin dynasty), with immeasurable wealth and seven treasures of gold and silver.

source_sentence: 田宅牛馬，不可稱計。
translation: The land, homes, cattle, and horses are incalculable.

source_sentence: 梵志有子，名曰畢撥學志，捨六十佉梨金寶好物及千具犁牛，捐仁賢妻，
translation: The brāhmaṇa had a son named Bimbisāra, who was an aspiring disciple. He gave up sixty ounces of gold treasure and one thousand sets of plows and cows to donate to Renqian’s wife.

source_sentence: 天下第一光顏微妙面色為最，心自念言：「當趣世間阿羅漢，學淨修梵行。」
translation: The most brilliant and subtle appearance in the world is his subtle countenance, and he thinks to himself, I'll go to the arhat of the world to train in the pure cultivation of the religious practice.

source_sentence: 詣多子神祠藥樹之下，噉食其果。
translation: He went to the foot of a heavily planted herb tree at the deity’s shrine in order to partake of the fruit.

source_sentence: 於是，世尊轉大法輪，轉法輪竟與比丘眾退，至多子神祠，止其精舍。
translation: At that time the World-honored One turned the great wheel of the Dharma. Having completed turning the wheel of the Dharma, he withdrew together with the assembly of monks and came to the deity shrine of many sons (i.e., Mahāprajāpatīṃśavartin), where he stayed in his monastery.

source_sentence: 於時，畢撥學志夜欲向明，住立遙見世尊在叢樹間，光明遠照，威曜普達，
translation: At that time the World-honored One was staying among the trees. His ray of light shone far and wide, shining with mighty majesty radiance reaching everywhere.

source_sentence: 志即念言：「今此叢樹，天已向明，威神普照，光明無量，殊妙巍巍。
translation: Zhixi then thought to himself, “This tree in the jungle is already illuminated by the gods; its majesty shines everywhere and its light is immeasurable. It is marvelously lofty and imposing.

source_sentence: 於此樹間，必有鹿王、大雄師子，若有天神及大神通神足大變，必爾不疑。
translation: Between these trees there must be a deer king and a great heroic lion, and if there are gods and great supernormal powers or miraculous abilities that have great transformations, they won't doubt it.

source_sentence: 我當往觀。」
translation: I will go and observe it.

source_sentence: 時畢撥學志，即從坐起，往詣叢樹，遙見世尊，光明百千，足底相文，
translation: Having abandoned his desire for learning, he rose from his seat and went to the grove. From a distance he saw the World-honored One with hundreds of thousands of rays of light beams extending as far as one hundred thousand yojanas in all directions, his feet touching each other’s feet.

source_sentence: 眾好具足，即時歎曰：「吾等先古神仙所遺經典，說有瑞應三十二大人之相，
translation: The thirty-two marks of a great man are reflected in the scriptures preserved by our ancient deities.

source_sentence: 分別具足，當趣二處，設在家者為轉輪聖王，主四天下，選擇要教，治以正法，
translation: They are endowed with discrimination and destined to go to two places. Those who remain householders will be wheel-turning sage kings, ruling over the four quarters of the earth; they will choose essential teachings and govern themselves by means of the right Dharma.

source_sentence: 刀杖兵甲，制而不施；
translation: Swords, sticks, weapons, and armor were not given to them.

source_sentence: 假使出家，棄國捐王，當為如來、至真、等正覺、明行成為、善逝、世間解、無上士、道法御、天人師，
translation: Suppose he renounces the householder’s life and abandons his kingdom. He becomes a teacher of the Tathāgata, Arhat, Completely Enlightened One, Perfect in Knowledge and Conduct, Well-gone, Knower of the World, Unsurpassed, Ruler of the Way, Teacher of gods and humans.

source_sentence: 號佛、世尊，寧可親覲。」
translation: They're called buddhas and world-honored ones, so they'd better be able to see them in person.

source_sentence: 畢撥學志，往詣佛所，覩世尊在於樹間端嚴而坐，猶大形象，七寶合成，
translation: Having set his mind on learning, he approached the Buddha and saw that the World-honored One was seated among the trees in an elegant manner, resembling a great figure made up of the seven kinds of treasure.

source_sentence: 威德巍巍，諸根寂定，道心靜然，逮最憺怕，忽然清淨，度于彼岸，猶若金山、若須彌王，
translation: Their majesty and virtue are majestic, their faculties are tranquil and concentrated, and their minds of enlightenment are quiescent. They have mastered the utmost fearlessness and suddenly become pure, crossing over to the farther shore like a mountain of gold or a polar mountain.

source_sentence: 猶如夜分坐於幽冥然大炬火，譬龍在深淵其水清涼；
translation: It is as if a great torch were to blaze in the darkness of the night, like a dragon deep in the ocean whose waters are clear and cool.

source_sentence: 相三十二莊嚴其身，如大山王頂有大火然、如日出山岡光曜普照、如月盛滿眾星獨明、如轉輪王眷屬圍繞；
translation: His body was adorned with the thirty-two marks of greatness, like a great fire blazing from the top of a great mountain; like the rising sun shining on the mountain’s peaks illumining all directions; like the moon filling the stars and alone shining brightly; like a universal ruler surrounded by his retinues.

source_sentence: 八十種好遍布其體，猶若干華，各各開擺億百千光，從聖體出。
translation: Eighty kinds of beautiful flowers pervaded its body, each like a certain number of flowers, each emitting billions of hundreds of millions of rays of light that emerged from the holy body.

source_sentence: 畢撥學志見佛如是，心懷欣然，如冥見光，尋趣世尊，揖讓談語，自達姓名，
translation: Having seen the Buddha in this way, Bimbisāra was delighted and looked as if he saw a ray of light shining from the darkness. He approached the World-honored One, bowed to him, exchanged greetings, and said his name.

source_sentence: 却坐一面。
translation: He sat to one side.

source_sentence: 佛為說經，解若干義，分別其慧。
translation: The Buddha taught the sūtras for them, understood certain meanings, and discerned their wisdom.

source_sentence: 論佛世尊有誨悅辭，布施持戒，愛欲之病，挑塵勞心，出家為上，憒擾諸品，
translation: The Buddha, the World-honored One, has exhorted and delighted in discourse. He bestows charity and keeps the precepts on those who are suffering from the disease of craving; he removes the mental afflictions caused by worldly desires with a mind free of mundane weariness, leaving household life being the foremost among them. He disciplines

source_sentence: 應病授藥；
translation: They prescribed medicine for the ill according to their illnesses.

source_sentence: 尊見其心，應時柔心，狐疑蓋心，悅信之心，罪福之心，若平等心，應心與合，
translation: When the venerable one sees his mind, he should have a gentle mind at the right time, a mind free from doubt and doubt, a mind filled with joy and faith, a mind of blameworthiness and a mind of blameworthiness. If he has an impartial mind, it should be combined with his mind.

source_sentence: 而為說法，如諸佛法，察其根源，而分別說苦習盡道。
translation: He teaches the Dharma for them, investigates their roots of faculties according to the teachings of the buddhas, and discriminates and explains the path leading to the end of suffering.

source_sentence: 即於坐上，遠塵離垢，諸法眼生，現在獲度；
translation: On his seat, far removed from the dust and dirt of defilement, the eye of insight into all truths arose. He was now liberated.

source_sentence: 覩見法源，分別經典，拔于狐疑，得立果證。
translation: Seeing the source of the teaching, he discerned scriptures, removed doubts, and attained the realization of establishment.

source_sentence: 受教誨慧，致勇猛法，即從座起，更整衣服，右膝著地，稽首佛足：「我初來時，
translation: Having received his instruction and wisdom, he attainted the courageous Dharma. He rose from his seat, adjusted his clothes, knelt with his right knee on the ground, and bowed his head at the Buddha’s feet. “When I first came here,

source_sentence: 觀尊足心，自說名字，觀佛相好，心懷踊躍，而失禮敬。」
translation: Observing the mind of the Bhagavān's feet, he tells his own name and observes the Buddha's good appearance, and his heart leaps and dances, but he doesn't venerate him.

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊告大迦葉：「是故賢者，從今以往，若族姓子！
translation: It was then that the Bhagavān addressed Mahākāśyapa, That's why, good man, from now on, if you're a clansman!

source_sentence: 有所至到，心念猶月，如月光照，種姓光明威曜，如是族姓子，開目而行。
translation: When something arrives, his mind is like the moon, like the moon shining brightly, and his family's light shines with authoritative radiance. Thus, a clansman opens his eyes and walks around.

source_sentence: 如是，迦葉！
translation: So it is, Kasyapa!

source_sentence: 從今日始，若族姓子！
translation: From today onward, if you're a clansman!

source_sentence: 制心修行，如月盛滿遊行空時。
translation: He restrains his mind and cultivates it, like when the moon flourishes and travels through space.

source_sentence: 是故迦葉！
translation: Therefore, Kāśyapa!

source_sentence: 從今日始，族姓子所遊至處，制心修行，猶如日光照於天下，其族姓子，
translation: From this day forth, wherever the clansmen and brāhmaṇas will go on their excursions, they should control their minds and practice with restraint, just as the light of the sun illumines the world.

source_sentence: 未曾閉目，制心修行，猶如日光，亦當如是。」
translation: Never has he closed his eyes and restrained his mind to cultivate it, just like the sunlight, which will be likewise.

source_sentence: 佛告迦葉：「從今日始，制心修行，猶如蜜蜂，所至到處，多所發起，
translation: The Buddha said to Kāśyapa: From today onward, one should control one’s mind and practice with restraint. One should follow the example of honey bees that go wherever they are and give rise to many different kinds of behavior.

source_sentence: 猶如蜜蜂採諸花味，不萎色香。
translation: It's like a honey bee picking the taste of flowers and not shrinking their color and fragrance.

source_sentence: 若族姓子！
translation: If you're a clansman!

source_sentence: 制心修行，從今日始，造行如是。」
translation: He restrains his mind and cultivates it, beginning today, and thus creates practices like this.

source_sentence: 佛告迦葉：「從今已往，制心修行，當如地水火風，得淨不喜，得諸不淨，
translation: The Buddha said to Kāśyapa: From now on, you should restrain your mind and practice. You should be like the earth, water, fire, and wind that are neither delighted by purity nor attached to impurity.

source_sentence: 屎、尿、膿血、死蛇、死人污露，不以愁憂；
translation: The defilements of excrement, urine, pus, blood, dead snakes, and corpses are not grieved.

source_sentence: 若得華香、金銀、七寶五種彩色，不以喜悅，無增無減。
translation: If he obtains the five kinds of colors of flowers, odor, gold, silver, and seven treasures, he doesn't rejoice without delight, neither increasing nor decreasing.

source_sentence: 族姓子！
translation: clansmen!

source_sentence: 制心修行，亦當如是。
translation: So it should be with the cultivation of disciplined mind.

source_sentence: 嗟歎稱譽，安樂歡豫，不以為悅；
translation: They lamented their praise and praise, felt at ease and rejoicing, and did not think they were delighted.

source_sentence: 若遇誹謗、眾苦、惱患，不以愁憂。」
translation: If you're subject to slander, numerous sufferings, and distress, don't grieve because of it.

source_sentence: 佛告迦葉：「從今日始，族姓子！
translation: The Buddha told Kāśyapa, From today on, clansmen!

source_sentence: 制心修行，當如拂淨物，亦拂不淨，亦拂屎、尿、涕、唾、膿血、死狗、死蛇、死人污露，
translation: He disciplines his mind and cultivates it, just as he sweeps clean objects and also sweeps what’s impure. He also sweeps away excrement, urine, tears, spittle, pus, blood, dead dogs, dead snakes, and the defiled flesh of dead people.

source_sentence: 不以淨悅，不淨不憂。
translation: They don’t delight in what’s pure and don’t grieve over what’s impure.

source_sentence: 若族姓子！
translation: If you're a clansman!

source_sentence: 制心修行，亦當如是。」
translation: So it will be with the cultivation of disciplined mind.

source_sentence: 佛告迦葉：「從今以往，制心修行，當如掃箒，淨亦掃，不淨亦掃。」
translation: The Buddha told Kāśyapa, From now on, he restrains his mind from cultivating it, just as he sweeps away what's pure and sweeps away what's impure.

source_sentence: 佛告迦葉：「從今以往，族姓子！
translation: The Buddha told Kāśyapa, From now on, clansmen!

source_sentence: 制心修行，當如凶祝子，常低頭行，在所至到，常內其手。
translation: When he restrains his mind and cultivates it, he should be like a fierce wish-granting boy who always walks with his head down and puts his hand inside his mouth wherever he goes.

source_sentence: 若裸形人，羞身不蔽，在於世間，趣欲活命，不說本姓，若可不可，不以自宣。
translation: If a naked person is shameful and doesn't cover his body, he's in the world who wants to live, doesn't say his original family name, and doesn't proclaim it for himself whether it's acceptable or not.

source_sentence: 若族姓子！
translation: If you're a clansman!

source_sentence: 制心修行，亦當如是。」
translation: So it will be with the cultivation of disciplined mind.

source_sentence: 佛告迦葉：「從今以往，族姓子！
translation: The Buddha told Kāśyapa, From now on, clansmen!

source_sentence: 制心修行，如截角牛，如牛截角，賢善柔順，不貪四事，詣於四衢，於四衢道，
translation: He restrains his mind and practices like a horned cow or an ox cutting its horns. Being wise and gentle, he does not crave the four kinds of things. He approaches the four quarters [of the city] and follows the four thoroughfares.

source_sentence: 無有門戶，而危其命。
translation: There are no doors or windows, and their lives are in danger.

source_sentence: 若族姓子！
translation: If you're a clansman!

source_sentence: 制心修行，亦當如是。」
translation: So it will be with the cultivation of disciplined mind.

source_sentence: 佛告迦葉：「從今以往，制心修行，當如鐵釜，又如諸燈，如釜燈穿多有孔漏滿中油脂。
translation: The Buddha told Kāśyapa, From now on, he should restrain his mind and cultivate it, like an iron pot or a lamp that penetrates through many holes and fills it with oil and fat.

source_sentence: 如明眼人從一邊觀，釜燈諸孔脂油漏出，各各墮地。
translation: It's like when a person with clear eyesight observes from one side, the pores of a pot or lamp and grease and oil leak out, each falling to the ground.

source_sentence: 若族姓子！
translation: If you're a clansman!

source_sentence: 察身非常，四大合成，九孔穿漏，皆出不淨，不貪樂身，不以為奇。」
translation: He observes that the body is impermanent, composed of the four elements, nine pores penetrating contaminants, all emitting impure things, and he doesn't crave the body or think it's strange.

source_sentence: 於是大迦葉，從佛世尊聞月喻行，即受諷誦觀八脫門。
translation: Mahākāśyapa then heard the moon metaphor from the Buddha, the Bhagavān, and accepted the recitation of the contemplation of the eight liberations.

source_sentence: 佛告迦葉：「詣光曜樹。」
translation: The Buddha told Kāśyapa, Go to the Ābhāsvara tree.

source_sentence: 迦葉應曰：「唯然世尊！」
translation: Kāśyapa replied, Yes, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 即從坐起，在佛後住。
translation: He rose from his seat and remained behind the Buddha.

source_sentence: 時，佛與大迦葉，出其叢樹，詣異叢樹。
translation: At that time, the Buddha and Mahākāśyapa came out of their clusters of trees and went to another cluster of trees.

source_sentence: 尋復出去，坐異樹下，告大迦葉：「於此樹下，為如來敷座，吾身疲弊，
translation: Then he went out and sat under a different tree. He said to Mahākāśyapa, “Under this tree I prepared a seat for the Tathāgata.

source_sentence: 其背甚痛。」
translation: His back is very painful.

source_sentence: 迦葉受教，促疾促疾，為佛敷座，令其方正。
translation: Kāśyapa accepted the teaching, became ill and ill-willed, and prepared his seat for the Buddha so that it would be arranged squarely.

source_sentence: 敷座已竟，前白大聖：「敷座已訖，唯願就席。」
translation: When the seat had been prepared, he said to the great sage, The seat has been prepared, so please take a seat.

source_sentence: 佛尋坐竟，告迦葉曰：「是地柔軟，細滑妙好。」
translation: When the Buddha had finished his seat, he told Kāśyapa, This is a soft, fine, and marvelous surface.

source_sentence: 迦葉曰：「唯然世尊，彼地此地，今者人身，會歸此地。
translation: Kāśyapa said: Yes, World-Honored One. The people of that land and this land are now returning to this land as human beings.

source_sentence: 唯然世尊，歸於盡滅，持心忍辱，當如是地。
translation: But, World-Honored One, you should return to the state of total cessation. With a mind imbued with forbearance, you should remain in this state.

source_sentence: 今我法衣，亦猶柔好，願佛愍傷，加哀受之。」
translation: Now, my Dharma robe is still soft and gentle, so may the Buddha take pity on me and accept it with compassion.

source_sentence: 佛告迦葉：「假使我受柔軟絳衣，汝服何等？」
translation: The Buddha told Kāśyapa, Suppose I were to accept a soft and supple robe, what would you wear?

source_sentence: 迦葉白佛：「往古諸世尊讚譽，若族姓子，著塚間死人弊衣及五納衣，
translation: Kāśyapa said to the Buddha: World-honored One, from ancient times all the world-honored ones praised those clansmen and brāhmaṇas who stayed in a cemetery wearing the rag robes of the dead and the five patches of white cloth.

source_sentence: 為安諸天及世間人。」
translation: It's to pacify the gods and worldly people.

source_sentence: 佛言：「善哉，善哉！
translation: The Buddha said, Good, good!

source_sentence: 迦葉！
translation: Kāśyapa!

source_sentence: 多所哀愍，多所安隱，著弊納衣，往古諸佛，所稱歎者。
translation: They had many pities and were mostly peaceful, wearing outdated undergarments. The buddhas of ancient times praised them.

source_sentence: 迦葉！
translation: Kāśyapa!

source_sentence: 汝起促取水來，吾甚飢渴，意欲飲水。」
translation: Come up and quickly get some water, for I'm so hungry and thirsty that I want to drink water.

source_sentence: 「唯然，世尊！」
translation: Yes, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 即受教起，稽首足下，繞佛三匝，促疾促疾，欲行取水。
translation: He then accepted the instruction and got up, bowed his head at his feet, circumambulated the Buddha three times, and wanted to go to fetch water.

source_sentence: 諸比丘見，尋時問之：「仁為耆年，不以貢高，亦不憂慼，寂除凶欲入無所處，
translation: When the bhikṣus saw him, they looked into his affairs and asked him: Sir, you are an elderly man who is neither arrogant nor arrogant. He has no sorrowful feelings of anguish or displeasure. Quietly extinguishing ferocious desires he enters a place where there is nothing to be done.

source_sentence: 何因為沙門欲受具戒，今所至？」
translation: Why is it that the ascetic wants to receive the full set of precepts, and where will he go now?

source_sentence: 迦葉報曰：「汝等詣佛，以持此事，自問大聖，悉當為汝分別說之。」
translation: Kāśyapa replied, All of you go to the Buddha and ask the great sage about this matter so that he can explain it separately for you.

source_sentence: 於時，賢者大迦葉，即取水來，往奉上佛。
translation: Good man Mahākāśyapa then brought the water and went to present it to the Buddha.

source_sentence: 佛尋受之，飲水竟，便殘水持與。
translation: The Buddha sought to receive it, and when he had finished drinking water, he took the remaining water and gave it to him.

source_sentence: 迦葉即受，以著一面，長跪叉手，右膝著地，更整衣服，白世尊曰：「我行取水，
translation: Kāśyapa then accepted it, put it to one side, knelt with palms joined together, knelt with his right knee touching the ground, adjusted his clothes, and said to the World-honored One:

source_sentence: 見諸弟子及諸比丘，問我曰：『仁為耆年，不以貢高，不以憂慼，亦不癡妄，
translation: Seeing this, the disciples and other monks asked me, “Your majesty, you are an elderly man who is neither arrogant nor arrogant.

source_sentence: 寂諸四事眾欲之凶。』
translation: Quiet the four deeds and the badness of all desires.'

source_sentence: 我自捨六十佉犁金妙珍寶犁牛千具，棄妻玉女天下第一，其有世間能成羅漢，
translation: I renounced my wife, the jadelike queen, foremost among all women in the world. If there is anyone in the world who can attain arhatship,

source_sentence: 吾當從受。
translation: I will accept it from you.

source_sentence: 今者弟子，諸比丘眾，悉來問吾。
translation: Now, my disciples and the assembly of monks have all come to ask me questions.

source_sentence: 「我時前在多子神祠，在藥樹下，噉其果蓏，於是世尊未受具戒。
translation: “At the time, I was in front of the deva temple of many sons at the foot of a medicinal tree and parched its fruit. The Bhagavat had not received the full set of precepts.

source_sentence: 爾時世尊，遊於王舍城，我時在竹樹間迦蘭園，明旦著衣，持鉢入城分衛，
translation: At that time the World-honored One was staying at Rājagaha. I was staying in the Kalandaka Park between the bamboo trees. On the morning, putting on my outer robe and taking my bowl, I entered the city to guard it.

source_sentence: 見日大殿有千光出。
translation: He saw a thousand rays of light emanate from the great hall of the sun.

source_sentence: 時佛世尊，在王舍城迦蘭竹樹間。
translation: The Bhagavān then stayed among the Kalandaka bamboo trees in Rājagṛha.

source_sentence: 時見世尊，吾自憶念，謂日更出，若大天神，夜忽如晝。
translation: When I saw the World-honored One, I thought to myself: As the sun rose at dawn, a great heavenly god suddenly appeared as if it were daytime.

source_sentence: 時佛晡時從宴坐起，如月宮殿振大光明，則以覆蔽諸日月光，譬如大炬照於闇冥。
translation: When the Buddha arose from his meditation in the late afternoon, it was as if the moon palace were shining with a great ray of light that covered the light of the sun and moon like a great torch shining in the darkness.

source_sentence: 佛在弟子眾中，威神光明，亦復如是，為諸比丘，講說經法，如轉輪王，
translation: Similarly, when the Buddha was in the assembly of disciples, he taught the doctrine of scriptures for the sake of the bhikṣus like a universal monarch.

source_sentence: 與諸子眷屬俱，與無央數眾比丘俱。
translation: He's accompanied by his children and retinues, and he's accompanied by an immeasurable number of monks.

source_sentence: 吾爾時觀死不覩見諸比丘眾，無能受者，無能為師，唯獨如來，將出世間，
translation: At that time I observed death and did not see the monks. There was no one to receive it, and no one could serve as my teacher. It was only the Tathāgata alone who was about to appear in the world.

source_sentence: 興隆道化，而取滅度，今諸比丘，故來問我。」
translation: They prospered in the path of teaching and then entered nirvāṇa, but now the monks have come to ask me questions.

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊告迦葉曰：「多有比丘，不了善惡，覺與不覺，不解福田，
translation: At that time the World-honored One said to Kasyapa: Many monks do not understand wholesome and unwholesome [dharmas]. They discriminate between what is perceived and what is not perceived, and they do not understand the field of blessedness.

source_sentence: 諸法之處多有義理，是說第一，迦葉最尊；
translation: Where all the teachings are found, there is much meaning and principle. This explanation is foremost; Kāśyapa is the most venerable of them all.

source_sentence: 不以貢高，平等無憂，寂諸四事諸欲之凶，第一成就，受具足戒。」
translation: They won't be arrogant, have equality and no sorrow, quiescence in the badness of the four things and desires, achieve the first accomplishment, and receive the full set of precepts.

source_sentence: 佛說如是，賢者迦葉，及諸比丘莫不歡喜。
translation: Good man, when the Buddha said this, no one but Kasyapa and the other monks rejoiced.

source_sentence: 佛說大迦葉本經
translation: Mahākāśyapa-sūtra
